messages.content: what is going on w research funding now?

As of July 16, 2025, research funding is experiencing a complex and dynamic landscape, shaped by both promising opportunities and significant challenges.

**General Trends and Key Areas of Focus:**

Globally, there's an increasing emphasis on funding research related to sustainability, climate change, equity, diversity, and inclusion (EDI), and interdisciplinary collaboration [cayuse](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0). The integration of data science to improve access to and use of biomedical and behavioral data is also a priority [nih](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1). Efficiency in R&D, reduced medicine development times, and increased probabilities of success are being emphasized [iqvia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2). Public-private partnerships are being fostered to accelerate innovation [cayuse](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0).

**Specific Funding Initiatives:**

*   **Biopharma:** Biopharma R&D funding has increased, reaching a 10-year high of $102 billion in 2024 [iqvia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-5) [iqvia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2).
*   **Horizon Europe:** Horizon Europe will invest €7.3 billion in 2025, focusing on green and digital transitions [eua](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-6).
*   **Canada:** The Canadian government is providing over $1.3 billion to support researchers and projects [canada](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-7).
*   **Foundations:** Foundations like Kauffman, Merck, William T. Grant, and Leakey are focusing on areas such as equitable economic mobility, biomanufacturing, inequality reduction, and human origins, respectively [kauffman](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-8) [merckgroup](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-9) [wtgrantfoundation](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-10) [leakeyfoundation](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-11).

**Challenges and Concerns, Particularly in the US:**

Federal funding cuts are reshaping research across the U.S., causing delayed grants, hiring freezes, and overall uncertainty [biorender](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-12) [universityofcalifornia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-13) [forbes](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-14). Policy changes introduced by the Trump administration in early 2025, including funding freezes and restrictions on indirect costs, have exacerbated these issues [atomgrants](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-15). Proposed budget cuts for Fiscal Year 2026 include significant reductions for the CDC, NASA, and NIH [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0). Over $1.5 billion in federal grant money has been terminated, with STEM education grants accounting for a significant portion [nea](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-4). Restrictions have also been placed on research topics related to climate change, DEI, and international collaborations [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0) [atomgrants](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-5). These cuts are projected to have long-term consequences, including economic decline, stalled breakthroughs, and a loss of global scientific leadership [aau](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-7) [american](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-8) [insightintoacademia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-4).

**UK's Approach to Long-Term Funding:**

In contrast, the UK government is introducing criteria to support long-term, ten-year funding for R&D activities, aiming to provide certainty and attract private investment [www](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3) [openaccessgovernment](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0) [www](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-1). These criteria focus on infrastructure, talent, international collaboration, and partnerships with businesses [openaccessgovernment](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0) [research-live](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-2).

**Strategies for Researchers:**

Given these trends, researchers are diversifying funding sources, adapting to new priorities, and emphasizing collaboration [biorender](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-12) [cayuse](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0). The NIH is also prioritizing human-focused research [nih](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1).

search_query: What specific policy changes introduced by the Trump administration in early 2025 are impacting research funding and grant processes?
What are the specific criteria introduced by the UK government to support long-term (ten-year) funding for R&D activities?
How are federal funding cuts in the US specifically impacting different research fields or institutions, and what are the projected long-term consequences?
web_research_result:
Okay, I will conduct Google Searches to gather the most recent information on "current trends in research funding 2025" and synthesize it into a verifiable text artifact.
Here's a summary of current trends in research funding for 2025, based on the search results:

**General Trends and Overviews:**

*   **Increased Focus on Key Areas:** Research funding in 2025 is increasingly focused on sustainability, climate change, equity, diversity, and inclusion (EDI), and interdisciplinary collaboration [cayuse](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0).
*   **Data Science Integration:** There's a push for greater integration of data science to improve access to and use of biomedical and behavioral data [nih](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1).
*   **Efficiency and Productivity:** There's an emphasis on improving the efficiency of R&D, reducing medicine development times, and increasing probabilities of success [iqvia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2).
*   **Public-Private Partnerships:** Fostering public-private partnerships to accelerate innovation and bring research breakthroughs to market is expected [cayuse](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0).
*   **Long-Term Funding Certainty (UK):** The UK government is introducing new criteria to support long-term, ten-year funding for certain R&D activities, providing certainty to research organizations and attracting private investment [www](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3).
*   **Global Competition:** Increased global research competition and collaboration are impacting funding trends [huronconsultinggroup](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4).

**Specific Funding Trends:**

*   **Biopharma R&D:** Biopharma funding has increased for the second consecutive year, with growth contributions from IPOs, follow-on funding, and other public and private sources [iqvia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-5) [iqvia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2). Funding reached a 10-year high of $102 billion in 2024, a substantial increase over the $71 billion in 2023 [iqvia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-5).
*   **Horizon Europe (EU):** Horizon Europe will invest €7.3 billion in 2025 to advance research and innovation across Europe, with a focus on green and digital transitions and enhancing Europe's global competitiveness.  [eua](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-6)At least 35% of the total funding will support climate-related objectives, and 8.8% will contribute to biodiversity goals.  [eua](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-6)Approximately €1.6 billion will be invested in the development and deployment of artificial intelligence.
*  [eua](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-6)  **Canadian Research:** The Canadian government is providing over $1.3 billion in funding to support over 9,700 researchers and research projects across Canada.
*  [canada](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-7)  **Kauffman Foundation:** The Kauffman Foundation is focusing on research projects that advance the understanding of how to expand equitable economic mobility and increase opportunity.
*  [kauffman](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-8)  **Merck Research Grants:** Merck is offering research grants to stimulate innovative research in areas such as smart consumables for digital integration in biomanufacturing processes and multi-purpose microphysiological systems.
*  [merckgroup](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-9)  **William T. Grant Foundation:** The William T. Grant Foundation is funding research studies that aim to reduce inequality in the academic, social, behavioral, or economic outcomes of young people ages 5-25 in the United States.
*  [wtgrantfoundation](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-10)  **Leakey Foundation:** The Leakey Foundation supports research related to human origins, evolution, and behavior.

* [leakeyfoundation](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-11)*Challenges and Concerns:**

*   **Federal Funding Cuts (US):** Federal funding cuts are reshaping research across the U.S., with delayed grants, hiring freezes, and uncertainty. Th [biorender](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-12) [universityofcalifornia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-13) [forbes](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-14)ere are concerns about the U.S. losing its position as a global scientific leader.
*  [biorender](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-12) [universityofcalifornia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-13)  **Impact of Policy Changes (US):** Policy changes, such as those introduced by the Trump administration in early 2025 (freezing grants, slashing indirect cost reimbursements), have created uncertainty in the research community.
*  [atomgrants](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-15)  **University Financial Distress (UK):** Small increases to the R&D budget in the UK may not be sufficient to capitalize on research strengths, given the financial distress felt across Higher Education Institutions.
*  [wellcome](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-16)  **Sustainability of Funding:** There are concerns about whether current funding levels are sustainable and sufficient to meet long-term goals.

* [oecd](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-17) [wellcome](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-16)*Strategies for Researchers:**

*   **Diversifying Funding Sources:** Researchers are increasingly pursuing alternative, non-federal funding sources such as private foundations and industry partnerships.
*  [biorender](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-12)  **Adapting to New Priorities:** Researchers need to stay informed about federal policy changes and adapt to new funding processes.
*  [cayuse](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0)  **Collaboration:** Increased encouragement for interdisciplinary collaboration to tackle complex global challenges.
*  [cayuse](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0)  **Focus on Human-Based Research:** The NIH is prioritizing human-focused research and reducing animal use in research.

* [nih](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1)*Other Trends:**

*   **Venture Capital Activity:** Investors are feeling more bullish on the outlook for venture capital activity and high-growth public equities heading into 2025. Ra [hsbc](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-18)pid adoption of AI and a supportive rate environment are seen as tailwinds, while political risk is a key headwind.
*  [hsbc](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-18)  **Biotech Funding:** Biotech investors are focusing on programs with proven science, robust biomarker data, and well-defined regulatory and commercialization pathways, especially in advanced therapies and oncology.
*  [precisionformedicine](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-19)  **CRO Market:** The global Contract Research Organization (CRO) market is evolving, with sponsors seeking comprehensive partners who can guide complex regulatory pathways, manage specialized laboratory work, and develop effective commercial strategies.
*  [precisionformedicine](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-19)  **Project 2025 (US):** Proposals exist to prioritize basic research, roll back climate science, and cut research ties with China.
 [aip](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-20)

Okay, I will conduct targeted Google Searches to gather the most recent, credible information on "What specific policy changes introduced by the Trump administration in early 2025 are impacting research funding and grant processes?" and synthesize it into a verifiable text artifact.
Based on the search results, here's a summary of specific policy changes introduced by the Trump administration in early 2025 impacting research funding and grant processes:

**1. Funding Cuts and Freezes:**

*   **Significant budget cuts proposed:** The Trump administration proposed substantial cuts to several science agencies for Fiscal Year 2026, including the CDC (44% cut), NASA science directorate (52% cut), and NIH (40% cut) [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0).
*   **Initial funding freeze:** In January 2025, the administration froze federal grants, loans, and other financial assistance programs, causing widespread confusion and concern [cbsnews](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-1) [atomgrants](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-2). Although this freeze was later rescinded, the funding pause was maintained to "end any confusion" [cbsnews](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-1).
*   **NIH Funding Cuts:** On February 7, 2025, the Trump administration announced $4 billion in cuts to medical research funding at universities, hospitals, and other institutions [columbia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-3).
*   **Grant Terminations:** More than $1.5 billion in federal grant money has been terminated by the Trump administration [nea](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-4). As of early May 2025, STEM education grants accounted for 54% of those terminations, a loss of $773 million in funding [nea](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-4).
*   **Impact on Specific Research Areas:** Broad research areas targeted include climate change, vaccine hesitancy, HIV/AIDS, and COVID-19. Funding for research related to LGBTQ issues, gender, diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI), race and ethnicity, and other topics deemed "woke" has also been targeted [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0).

**2. Restrictions on Indirect Costs:**

*   **Capping indirect cost rates:** The administration moved to cap indirect cost rates for universities at 15% at major agencies like NIH, NSF, DOE and DOD [atomgrants](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-5). These caps are a significant reduction from previous rates, which typically ranged from 27-30% [atomgrants](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-5).
*   **Legal challenges to indirect cost caps:** These caps faced legal challenges and temporary injunctions [atomgrants](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-5). Federal judges blocked the Department of Energy and the National Science Foundation from instituting the proposed 15% cap on indirect costs [columbia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-3).
*   **Impact of indirect cost caps:** Universities estimated significant financial losses due to these changes. For example, the University of California estimated a loss of nearly $100 million a year [cbsnews](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-6). Smaller research universities and teaching hospitals, particularly those in rural areas, are disproportionately affected [arnoldporter](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-7).

**3. Restrictions on Research Topics and International Collaborations:**

*   **Executive Order on Biological Research:** An executive order in May 2025 prohibited federal funding for "dangerous gain-of-function" research, especially in countries lacking adequate biosafety oversight (e.g., China) [atomgrants](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-5).
*   **Restrictions on DEI and "Gender Ideology":** Executive orders and agency guidance have restricted funding for research involving DEI, "gender ideology," and certain green energy projects [atomgrants](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-5).
*   **Halting NIH grants to international partners:** The NIH halted most new grant awards to foreign partners working in US-led research consortia, citing "national security" reasons [sciencebusiness](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-8).

**4. Changes to Grant Processes and Scientific Integrity:**

*   **Grant freezes and delays:** A temporary freeze on new federal research grants at NIH, NSF, and other agencies during policy reviews caused delays in funding cycles and uncertainty for researchers [atomgrants](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-5).
*   **New standards for scientific integrity and transparency:** The administration mandated new standards for scientific integrity and transparency in federally funded research [atomgrants](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-5).
*   **Review of grant proposals:** Grant review panels were paused to review whether projects supported potentially banned activities such as increasing diversity among scientists, international collaborations, or research into environmentally-friendly technology [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0).

**5. Impact on Research Institutions and Scientists:**

*   **Layoffs and job losses:** The NIH fired 1,000 to 1,200 workers on February 15 [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0). The NSF announced it would lay off 25% to 50% of its workforce, and 10% of NSF staff (168 employees) were fired on February 18 [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0).
*   **"Brain drain" concerns:** By February 2025, the scale of funding cuts raised concerns of a "brain drain," with a significant percentage of scientists considering leaving the country [wikipedia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-0).
*   **Disruption of research projects:** Research projects have been cut, including those focused on discerning AI-generated fake videos and examining belief in repeated lies on social media [cbsnews](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-6). A sickle cell disease study was terminated due to DEI concerns [pbs](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-9).
*   **Loss of research infrastructure:** The cuts would dramatically reduce funds for essential research infrastructure and administration at universities [atomgrants](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-5).

**6. Legal and Political Responses:**

*   **Lawsuits and injunctions:** Multiple lawsuits were filed against the administration's policies, and judges have blocked or paused some of the changes, including the caps on indirect costs [columbia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-3) [cbsnews](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-6).
*   **Congressional action:** House Republicans are developing a budget reconciliation package that would cut federal funding, including services and supports that increase public safety [americanprogress](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-10).

**7. Executive Orders Targeting DEI:**

*   **Executive Order on DEI:** Executive orders have been issued to end illegal discrimination and restore merit-based opportunity, rescinding directives related to DEI initiatives [hinckleyallen](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-11). These orders create exposure for institutions for False Claims Act investigations and enforcement [hinckleyallen](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-11).
*   **Prohibition of DEI factors:** The federal government is prohibited from considering DEI factors in federal spending [hinckleyallen](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-11).

These policy changes have created significant uncertainty and disruption for researchers and institutions, with many policies under court review or subject to further agency guidance [atomgrants](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/1-5).

The UK government has introduced specific criteria to support long-term (ten-year) funding for Research and Development (R&D) activities, designed to provide stability to research organizations and stimulate economic growth [openaccessgovernment](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0) [www](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-1). These criteria guide government departments and public bodies in identifying and prioritizing projects for long-term support [openaccessgovernment](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0) [research-live](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-2).

The four key criteria are:
*   **Infrastructure and core capabilities:** Funding will support the development and maintenance of critical national research infrastructure that cannot be sustained through short-term funding cycles [openaccessgovernment](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0) [research-live](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-2). This includes support for more impactful use of such infrastructure [computerweekly](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-3).
*   **Talent attraction and retention:** Long-term support will help build and sustain a skilled workforce in priority areas, ensuring the UK remains globally competitive in research and innovation [openaccessgovernment](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0) [research-live](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-2). This involves developing a pipeline of skilled researchers, scientists, and engineers [computerweekly](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-3) [research-live](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-2).
*   **International collaboration:** Projects that open up new global partnerships with strategic benefits will be prioritized, helping the UK stay connected to cutting-edge science worldwide [openaccessgovernment](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0).
*   **Partnerships and business collaboration:** Funding will target areas where industry, charities, or philanthropic organizations are ready to co-invest but where short-term funding has previously hindered partnership development [openaccessgovernment](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0) [research-live](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-2). This also applies where there is a demonstrated need for long-term industry partnerships and collaboration to address major challenges relevant to economic growth [europeanpharmaceuticalreview](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-4).

These criteria align with the government's Industrial Strategy and aim to foster a pro-business environment [www](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-5) [techuk](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-6). The government expects that these ten-year commitments will stimulate greater business confidence and investment in the UK's research ecosystem [openaccessgovernment](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0). Evidence suggests that every £1 of public investment in R&D attracts £2 in private investment and generates £7 in net economic benefits.

 [innovationnewsnetwork](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-7) [www](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-1) [openaccessgovernment](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0)While focusing on long-term funding, the government also ensures that departments retain the flexibility to respond to emerging scientific challenges. P [openaccessgovernment](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0)ublic bodies are encouraged to limit how much of their R&D budget can be tied up in ten-year commitments at any one time, balancing long-term stability with short-term agility. D [openaccessgovernment](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-0) [www](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-1)epartments will operate their own selection processes in line with the guidance, allowing them to implement a targeted approach and allocate ten-year budgets to specific programs, activities, and smaller research organizations.
 [www](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-1) [computerweekly](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-3) [sciencecampaign](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/2-8)

Federal funding cuts in the US are significantly impacting various research fields and institutions, leading to projected long-term consequences [dailycollegian](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-0) [universityofcalifornia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-1) [anilocus](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-2). These cuts, proposed by the Trump administration, have resulted in frozen or terminated grants, causing researchers and universities to scramble for adjustments [dailycollegian](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-0).

**Specific Impacts on Research Fields and Institutions:**

*   **National Institutes of Health (NIH):** The Trump administration froze $1.5 billion in NIH funding [dailycollegian](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-0). A proposed $18 billion cut to the NIH's 2026 budget is causing widespread alarm [latimes](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-3). As of May 1, 2025, the NIH has reduced its funding to health research by 20 percent [universityofcalifornia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-1).
*   **Environmental Protection Agency (EPA):** The EPA announced the elimination of its scientific research office, the Office of Research and Development [dailycollegian](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-0). As many as 1,155 scientists may be fired to eliminate 65 percent of its budget [dailycollegian](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-0).
*   **National Science Foundation (NSF):** The NSF has awarded about $1 billion less in grants for new research than its average over the past 10 years and has terminated more than 1,700 active grants for existing projects worth about $1.4 billion [universityofcalifornia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-1).
*   **Department of Energy (DOE):** The DOE's Bioenergy Research Centers lost $47 million, delaying sustainable biomaterials development [anilocus](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-2).
*   **Universities:** Universities are facing significant financial strain [insightintoacademia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-4). For example, the University of Massachusetts Amherst, which received $38 million in funding in 2024, faces an estimated loss of $6 million [dailycollegian](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-0). Harvard University faces a $2.2 billion funding freeze affecting its medical and public health schools [diverseeducation](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-5). Johns Hopkins University announced 2,200 layoffs directly attributed to declining federal research funding [diverseeducation](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-5).

**Impact on Specific Research Areas:**

*   **Medical Research:** Research impacted includes early detection of Alzheimer's disease and the effect of ambient air pollution on men's reproductive health [dailycollegian](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-0). Nanoscale drug delivery systems, critical to precision medicine, are also threatened [anilocus](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-2).
*   **Environmental Science:** Research on pollution, the impact of fracking on drinking water, the impact of wildfire smoke on public health, and climate change is affected [dailycollegian](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-0). Studies on biodegradable drug delivery systems are also threatened [anilocus](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-2).
*   **Nanotechnology, Clean Energy, and Agriculture:** Federal agencies like the NIH, NSF, and DOE have faced budget reductions, stalling progress in these areas [anilocus](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-2).
*   **Agriculture:** Federal support for agricultural research has already declined by a third over the last two decades, and universities are being forced to curtail operations [insightintoacademia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-4).

**Projected Long-Term Consequences:**

*   **Economic and Workforce Decline:** Over 5,000 STEM positions could be eliminated nationwide, disproportionately affecting early-career researchers [anilocus](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-2). A brain drain is also a concern, with 68% of postdocs surveyed considering leaving the U.S. if funding instability continues [latimes](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-3) [anilocus](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-2) [biorender](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-6).
*   **Stalled Breakthroughs:** The 2013 NIH sequester delayed cancer immunotherapy research by 3+ years, and similar cuts now threaten nanoscale drug delivery systems [anilocus](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-2).
*   **Sustainability Setbacks:** Cuts are destabilizing critical environmental health research, including studies on biodegradable drug delivery systems and long-term nanomaterial safety research [anilocus](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-2).
*   **Reduced GDP and Economic Growth:** A 25% cut to federal spending on research and development would reduce the United States GDP by an amount comparable to the decline in GDP during the Great Recession [aau](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-7) [american](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-8). A 50% cut would make the average American approximately $10,000 poorer [aau](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-7) [american](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-8).
*   **Loss of Global Scientific Leadership:** Experts warn that the cuts could undermine America's position as a global leader in science [insightintoacademia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-4). As research funding challenges grow, U.S. scientists are being offered positions overseas [universityofcalifornia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-1) [ucla](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-9).
*   **Impact on Innovation:** Cutting federal R&D spending would have outsized impacts on the economy because the government typically funds research that is often deemed too risky by private investors but which increases "the stock of knowledge in the economy and directly boost[s] GDP in the long run by increasing aggregate productivity" [aau](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-7).
*   **Job Losses:** Proposed NIH funding cuts could lead to an estimated $16 billion in economic loss and 68,000 jobs lost nationwide [umd](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-10) [upenn](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-11).
*   **Hindered Research Progress:** 90% of respondents believe budget cuts will hinder research progress [biorender](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-6).

**Institutional Responses:**

*   The University of Massachusetts Amherst announced a new Research Continuity Emergency (ResCoE) Matching Fund to provide a one-to-one match for funds to support research [dailycollegian](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-0).
*   Many labs are ramping up grant submissions and shifting their focus to match available funding [biorender](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-6).
*   Senior research leaders are actively pursuing alternative, non-federal funding sources such as private foundations and industry partnerships [biorender](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-6).

The cuts to federal science spending will have significant costs for every American [ucla](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-9) [universityofcalifornia](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/3-1).
